oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cultural Competencies and Planning for Teaching Mathematics: Preservice Teachers Responding to Expectations, Opportunities, and Resources
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilson, Susanna
McChesney, Jane
Brown, Liz
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cultually responsive teaching
preservice teacher's expectations
teacher education
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this article, the authors report on a small-scale study set in a context of a first-year mathematics education course for preservice primary teachers. Professional documentation from three different sources were analysed in relation to the national document TÄtaiako: Cultural Competencies for Teachers of MÄori Learners, which was used as a key course resource in a year-one mathematics education course for preservice teachers. The authors found evidence that the pre-service teachers used the resource to identify important learning and teaching practices, and as a source of language and examples. A further tentative finding was how relational aspects of teaching mathematics were adopted as indicators of culturally connected practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Journal of Urban Mathematics Education; Vol. 10 No. 1 (2017)
